title: The Help to Buy rules are changing – here's where you'll still be able to use the scheme
text:
Help to Buy has divided opinion: for some it’s the saviour of the housebuilding industry, for others it stoked property prices. In reality, both tags fit.

The state-backed scheme, introduced in 2013, was designed to help first-time buyers, providing an interest-free loan of 20 per cent (40 per cent in London); those purchasing only need a 5 per cent deposit. It was the Government’s way of incentivising housebuilders to keep building after the credit crunch. However, artificially driving demand kept prices moving faster than wages and compounded the affordability crisis.

Love it or loathe it, Help to Buy ends in 2023 – but not before one final twist. The Government is adding another layer of complexity...
